alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Bexar; Blanco; Burnet; Comal; Gillespie; Guadalupe; Hays; Karnes; Kendall; Kerr; Llano; Travis; Williamson; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 08 at 6:05PM CST until January 08 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions over the southern Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande plains Today... .A strong cold front is bringing very gusty west to northwest winds and low humidity to the southern Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande plains today. In addition, drought and freeze cured fuels along with the low humidity and gusty conditions will result in pockets of high fire danger over the Rio Grande plains, mainly south of Del Rio. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE HILL COUNTRY TO ALONG PORTIONS OF THE I-35 AND I-37 CORRIDORS... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 9 PM CST this evening. * WINDS...West 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly and exhibit resistance to control. Any outdoor activity that could produce flames or sparks is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
